Docs.summary: The protected no-arg constructor used by derived classes.

Docs.remarks: The resources associated with the parser are freed.

MemberSignature.Value: public static SemWeb.RdfReader Create (string type, string source);

Docs.param: The name of the source stream, as a file name, or "-" for standard input.
Docs.summary: Creates a parser in the factory paradigm.

returns.para: The type of parser returned is given in the following table.

Docs.summary: An entity to assign as the meta entity for statements loaded by this parser.
Docs.value: An entity to use for meta information, or .
Docs.remarks: The value of this property is used as the meta argument in calls to . The use of is up to the application.

Docs.summary: The base URI for resolving relative URIs found in the stream.
Docs.value: The base URI for resolving relative URIs found in the stream. May be, and is initially, .
Docs.remarks: When this property is , the parser may not be able to parse streams containing relative URIs. Always set this property before beginning reading if the stream could possibly contain relative URIs.

Docs.summary: Implementors of RdfReader may call this method to indicate a parsing warning.
Docs.remarks: This is not currently used for anything.

Docs.summary: A list of objects found in the strem that were marked as being variables (e.g. for queries).
Docs.value: A list of objects found in the strem that were marked as being variables (e.g. for queries).
Docs.remarks: The list of variables is set by the parser implementation. Not all parsers support variables. (N3-formatted RDF does, but XML formatted RDF doesn't.)

Docs.param: Each statement found in the stream is added to the statement sink via .
Docs.summary: Parses the stream into the statement sink.
Docs.remarks: User code should call rather than calling this method directly.

Docs.param: An entity that was marked as being a variable.
Docs.summary: Called by parser implementations to indicate that the entity was marked in the stream as being a variable for a query.
The base class of types that read statements from streams.

remarks.para: This is an abstract class. Implementations of readers are provided in this namespace and in .
